input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Gender has a direct effect on department competitiveness and brown eyes. Residency status has a direct effect on department competitiveness and brown eyes. Department competitiveness has a direct effect on brown eyes. Residency status is unobserved. The overall probability of male gender is 84%. The probability of non-male gender and brown eyes is 12%. The probability of male gender and brown eyes is 54%. Is the chance of brown eyes larger when observing male gender?
